org.csstudio.platform.security
Class SecurityFacade

java.lang.Object
  org.csstudio.platform.security.SecurityFacade

public final class SecurityFacade
extends Object

This Service executes instances of AbstractExecuteable if the current user has the permission to run them. It also provides some methods to ask whether the current user has the permission to access the objects behind an identifier. Offers methods to get the current instance of the IRights- and IUserManagement.

Author:
Kai Meyer & Torsten Witte & Alexander Will & Sven Wende & Jörg Rathlev & Anze Vodovnik & Xihui Chen

Method Detail

getInstance

public static SecurityFacade getInstance()
Returns:
The singleton instance of this class.

authenticateApplicationUser

public void authenticateApplicationUser()
Authenticates the user of the Control System Studio application. This will use the first available login module. If no login modules are available, no authentication takes place and the application will be used anonymously.

This method will usually be called during system startup.

isLoginOnStartupEnabled

public boolean isLoginOnStartupEnabled()
Returns whether automatic login on startup is enabled.

Returns:
true if login on startup is enabled, false otherwise.

Returns:
the handler.

canExecute

public boolean canExecute(String id)
Checks if the current user has the permission referenced by the given ID. This method will return false if no rights are configured for the given action, i.e. by default, the action can be executed by all non-anonymous users.

Parameters:
id - The ID of the right to check
Returns:
true if the user has the permission; false otherwise

canExecute

public boolean canExecute(String id,
                          boolean defaultPermission)
Checks if the current user has the permission referenced by the given ID.

Parameters:
id - The ID of the right to check
defaultPermission - this value will be returned if no rights are configured for the given action. Note that if you pass false here, the action will be disabled if no authorization plug-in is loaded.
Returns:
true if the user has the permission; false otherwise

canExecute

public boolean canExecute(String id,
                          LoginContext context,
                          boolean defaultPermission)
Checks if the current user has the permission referenced by the given ID based on the given login context.

Parameters:
id - The ID of the right to check.
context - The login context under which the right is needed.
defaultPermission - this value will be returned if no rights are configured for the given action. Note that if you pass false here, the action will be disabled if no authorization plug-in is loaded.
Returns:
Returns true if the user has permission and false otherwise.

getCurrentUser

public User getCurrentUser()
Returns the currently logged in user.

Returns:
the currently logged in user. Returns null if no user is currently logged in.

getRegisteredAuthorizationIds

public Collection<RegisteredAuthorizationId> getRegisteredAuthorizationIds()
Returns an unmodifiable collection of authorization IDs that are registered with the authorizationId extension point. If the same authorization ID is described by multiple extensions, only one description for that ID will be returned. The description for that ID will contain the usage declarations from all plug-ins declaring usages for that ID, and the description text for the ID itself from one of the plug-ins.

Returns:
an unmodifiable collection of registered authorization IDs.
